meanings.definition: The state of being silent or unable to speak.
meanings.sent1: Her mutenesses during the meeting made it difficult for others to understand her thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The mutenesses of the library created a peaceful atmosphere for reading.
meanings.sent3: The mutenesses of the sleeping cat was broken by a sudden loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The mutenesses of the forest at night was eerie, as if all the creatures were holding their breath.
meanings.sent5: The mutenesses of the snowfall blanketed the city in a serene quietness.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of lacking sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The mutenesses of the empty room echoed with loneliness.
meanings.sent2: The mutenesses of the desert was interrupted only by the occasional gust of wind.
meanings.sent3: The mutenesses of the broken speaker system made the concert sound like a distant whisper.
meanings.sent4: The mutenesses of the abandoned factory spoke volumes about its forgotten past.
meanings.sent5: The mutenesses of the underwater world was a peaceful escape from the noisy city above.
